node.title: Satellite images show mockups of US Navy ships in Chinese desert
node.alt: A close up satellite view of a navy carrier-shaped area in the Chinese desert
node.description: Satellite imagesÂ by space tech company Maxar have captured mockups in the shape of US Navy aircraft carriers and other warships in the Chinese desert.
node.content:
["Satellite images\u00a0by space tech company Maxar have captured mockups in the shape of US Navy aircraft carriers and other warships in the Chinese desert.", "The images show at least two different outlined mockups, including one that appears to be mounted a rail line.", "Here's what we know about them.\u00a0", "
Where have the mockups been built?\u00a0
", "", "
It might not look like much from far away, but these images have tongues wagging.\u00a0(Satellite image \u00a92021 Maxar Technologies)
", "According to the satellite imagery, the location of the mockups was identified as\u00a0Ruoqiang, a Taklamakan Desert county in the northwestern Xinjiang region.", "The pictures show a full-scale outline of a US carrier and at least two Arleigh Burke-class guided missile destroyers had been built at what appears to be a new target range complex in the Taklamakan Desert.", "They also show a 6m-wide rail system with a ship-sized target mounted on it, which experts say could be used to simulate a moving vessel.", "The United States Naval Institute (USNI) says the area has been used for ballistic missile testing in the past, citing data and imagery\u00a0from another\u00a0geospatial intelligence company called AllSource Analysis.", "", "
Experts say this mockup could be used to simulate a moving vessel.(Satellite image \u00a92021 Maxar Technologies)
", "
What will they be used for?\u00a0
", "It's not certain at this stage, but experts say a likely scenario is that they'll be used for target practice in military training.\u00a0", "USNI\u00a0News reports that the range of mockups \"shows that China continues to focus on anti-carrier capabilities, with an emphasis on US\u00a0Navy warships\".\u00a0", "\"Unlike the Iranian Navy\u2019s aircraft carrier-shaped target in the Persian Gulf, the new facility shows signs of a sophisticated instrumented target range,\" USNI News' report from November 7 said.\u00a0", "", "
It's not clear from the satellite images exactly how detailed the infrastructure is.(Satellite image \u00a92021 Maxar Technologies)
", "Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin told reporters during a briefing on Monday that he didn't have any information about the images.", "
Why the middle of the desert?\u00a0
", "Research fellow at Singapore's S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Collin Koh, said\u00a0ballistic missile tests in the desert would not reflect the realistic conditions of a marine environment, which could affect sensors and targeting, but would allow China to carry out the tests more securely.\u00a0", "\"I don't think the desert targets are going to be the final stage,\" he said.", "\"It's meant for further refinement.\"", "Dr Koh said\u00a0the Chinese military may have opted to do these tests inland to keep distance from US military and intelligence, but also because neighbouring countries may object to testing at sea due to the risk of missiles hitting other ships.\u00a0", "
Are mockups uncommon?\u00a0
", "No, not really.", "Military training and development varies around the world, but it's not uncommon for exercises to be based on real landmarks and infrastructure.\u00a0", "The UNSI points out China built an aircraft carrier target almost 20 years ago, in a section of the\u00a0Shuangchengzi missile test range.", "ABC/wires"]
